markdown.markdown: - **The UK MP Inbox** (website coming summer 2024) - A comprehensive database of thousands email newsletters sent by UK members of parliament. ## Data Science Training & Mentoring {{< fa brain >}} - **Verian Global Data Science Training seminar** - an annual internal seminar aimed at educating early career researchers about key DS principles and tools. - **Introduction to R Workshop Series** - an annual series of beginner-friendly workshops covering the basics of data wrangling and data visualisation. ## Academic Publications {{< fa file-pen >}} - **Ozer, Adam L.** 2023. “Women Experts and Gender Bias in Political Media”. *Public Opinion Quarterly*.  [**https://doi.org/10.1093/poq/nfad011**](https://doi.org/10.1093/poq/nfad011) - **Ozer, Adam L.** & Wright, Jamie. 2022. “Partisan News Versus Party Cues: The Effect of Cross-Cutting Party and Partisan Network Cues on Polarization and Persuasion”. *Research & Politics.*  [**https://doi.org/10.1177/20531680221075455**](https://doi.org/10.1177/20531680221075455) - **Ozer, Adam L.**, Sullivan, Brian W.,  & Van, Douglas S. 2022.  "Viewed from Different Engels? Differences in Reactions to “Socialism” as a Policy Label". *Political Research Quarterly*.  [**https://doi.org/10.1177/10659129211037402**](https://doi.org/10.1177/10659129211037402) - Simas, Elizabeth N. & **Ozer, Adam L.** 2021. “Polarization, candidate positioning, and political participation in the U.S.”. *Electoral Studies*, 73. [**https://doi.org/10.1016/j.electstud.2021.102370**](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.electstud.2021.102370) - **Ozer, Adam L.** 2020. "Well, you’re the expert: how signals of source expertise help mitigate partisan bias." *Journal of Elections, Public Opinion and Parties*, 1-21. [**https://doi.org/10.1080/17457289.2020.1744611**](https://doi.org/10.1080/17457289.2020.1744611) - Simas, Elizabeth N., & **Ozer, Adam L.** 2017. "Church or state? Reassessing how religion shapes impressions of candidate positions". *Research & Politics*, 4(2). [**https://doi.org/10.1177/2053168017716548**](https://doi.org/10.1177%2F2053168017716548)
